turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Like I've told you before I don't want you taking care of me.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Someone has to take care of you right now, Michael. You tore up the apartment. You stopped taking your medications.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: But that wasn't me.    I didn't mean to do that.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Well then why'd it happen?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I don't know. I don't fucking know.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I'm sorry.     I didn't come here to blame you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I didn't mean for any of this to happen.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Oh, God, Michael, I know.  Why does everything have to be so hard?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: What are we going to do?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What do you want to do?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I know I don't want to lose you.     I don't think I could stand it.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I love you so much.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I love you too, Letty.     I love you, too.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Maybe we could just run away to Tahiti and live on the beach.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: That's the best idea I've heard in a long time.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Don't you have a magic trick or something to make this easier?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: How about something better?   Like a kiss.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Would that really be such a good idea for either of us?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Just promise me you'll be OK, OK?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I will. And you make sure you take care of yourself.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I guess I should go now.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You should go.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: So, another one bites the dust.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: It's not another one. It's my sister.  Aren't you happy for her?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: She's only known the guy a few months.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Can I put these here for tonight?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: In there's better.  It's kind of romantic, don't you think?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I really think if you're going to spend your life with someone you want to know them pretty damn well.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Believe me, I know your feelings on the matter.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The receptionist said you called earlier about something.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: My math program. The Superintendent said he'd fund it.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Good going. I knew you could do it.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Huntley told me today that if I come through on the Benton deposition, they may consider me for senior associate.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I was thinking dinner on Friday with James and Meg at the Saint Mark.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I mean tonight.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Actually, I need to review the deposition questions tonight. Maybe tomorrow?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Oh, ok.   Maybe.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: But I thought if you don't mind, you could listen and see how I come across?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Sure. Of course.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What are you doing?    You're going to be late.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I'm calling in sick.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You don't have a fever.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I don't feel like going to work today.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Won't it be hard for them to get a substitute this late?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: But what about that math project?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Paul, I just can't go. Is that OK with you or am I committing some horrible crime?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Forget I asked.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I'm just...I'm so tired lately.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Maybe you ought to see a doctor.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: No, it's not like that.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: It's just I've got those parent conferences, and I'm supposed to set up the math program by next week. And shopping for Ruth's dress and that, that engagement dinner.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You can get out of the dinner.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: No, I can't. I've already convinced both Mom and Dad to come.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Come on, Letty.   It'll get done.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Of course it will. Remember the big talent show you planned last year? And what about the Christmas benefit when Santa canceled at the last minute? But you still pulled it off.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You just need to get more organized. L

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: You know what I think we need? Martinis. How about martinis to celebrate?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Can you loan me a 20?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Sure. Why?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I'm going to the store.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I think you're overreacting.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: It's prettier here than I thought it would be.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Yeah, I guess it's all right.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: That's a big question.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I hope it wasn't something I did.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Something you did?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Of course not, no.  Is that why you're here?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I think we need to talk about some things.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Yes, I suppose so.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: This has been really difficult, this whole thing.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Especially this last year.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Especially now.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: So, I've been thinking a lot...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I talked to Ruth a little bit, and I think it's about time...

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I know. We can't just keep going through the motions.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Exactly. It's time to make decisions.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: You don't have to say anything else. I've known for a while that this was coming.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I just wish we'd done it sooner.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I had to smuggle it in here. I guess you're not really supposed to have jewelry.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Or be up past ten or fraternize with other patients.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I hope you like it. It's a Marquis cut, 1.5 carats. They had one with emeralds around it, but this was simpler, more classic in its lines.  Letty?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: It's, it's really nice, Paul.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: No, you've done a perfect job.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: So, what do you say, Let?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Sure. We'll save the formal announcement for when you're out. I already told your mother. I hope you don't mind.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: No, no.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: So will you?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Of course. Yes. I will.     I do.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What's so urgent?   You've got me worried.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I need to tell you something, and I'm not sure how.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You can tell me anything.  Do you want to postpone the wedding? Is it too much pressure?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: That's a load off my mind.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You what?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I don't mean to hurt you.    I know this is a terrible thing.    And I have really loved you.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Whoa. Whoa. Have really loved me? Letty, it's natural to be nervous. But we're going to work through our problems.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I've met someone else.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: It doesn't matter who.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Have you been seeing another teacher?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: It's a doctor, isn't it? That's unethical. I'll have him rung up on malpractice charges so fast his head will spin.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: He's a patient here.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Of all the crazy things. I understood when you dropped out of law school. And during this whole mess, I've tried to be supportive. But, really, Letty, what can you be thinking?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I love him.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You're going to throw away our life together for some shared experience with a looney-tune that you misguidedly think is love?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Here's the ring.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No way. You keep the ring.     You'll come to your senses.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm glad you agreed to see me.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I'm just glad there aren't any hard feelings.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Oh, none. None. I completely understand what was going on.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: How's work going?    Are you back at school?

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I start on Monday.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Getting back.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I heard about your friend.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I heard your friend was back in the hospital.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Michael.   Yes.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Our relationship meant a lot to me, too, Paul. But it's over.  And Michael being in the hospital doesn't really change things.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I think I've heard this speech before.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I'm really sorry.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I've got a deposition that I really need to get cracking on, so if you don't mind...

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Sure, I understand.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL GAIL
turns.text: The Superintendent was just getting ready to leave.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I do apologize.    A student had a crisis.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Well, I understand.     I know my behavior was poor.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL GAIL
turns.text: So, in light of how the parents feel, and the fact the students are doing so well with the substitute, I don't think I can put you back in the classroom just yet.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Look, Gail, I've been a good teacher.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL GAIL
turns.text: I know, Letty. But the incident with Zach was frightening for the children.  Now if you'd come to me, explained what was going on...

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Believe me, I wish I'd understood what was going on. I've worked really hard to get better.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL GAIL
turns.text: I'm glad you're doing well.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: I've already thought about how to tell the kids where I was.

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL GAIL
turns.text: It's a very nice letter. But I have to go with what's best for the students.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL GAIL
turns.text: I need someone to work on budget projections.

turns.speaker: LETTY
turns.text: Office work?

turns.speaker: PRINCIPAL GAIL
turns.text: Or, of course, you could take a sabbatical the rest of the year.

turns.speaker: MRS. HALLSTROM
turns.text: All tapped out.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'll float you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: How's it look?

turns.speaker: MRS. HALLSTROM
turns.text: Shhh. They're coming to the cubic zirconium.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I like those sapphire earrings myself.

turns.speaker: MRS. HALLSTROM
turns.text: Simulated sapphires. I bet my daughter would love those, too.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Mrs. Hallstrom, why don't you join my family for dinner. You'll love my Grandma Rosa.

turns.speaker: MRS. HALLSTROM
turns.text: That's so sweet, Michael. But, really, I've so many things to do.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: We're talking Matisse, Renoir, Monet. We know for sure they replaced Van Gogh's "Vase with twelve sunflowers" last week with a copy. It was on loan from the London National Gallery and they're not going to be very happy when they find out about it.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: So Bastaldi makes a deal with the Feds to trade up for his brother?

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: Yeah. He delivers the goods on Zammito. If we got what we wanted we'd let his brother go providing he tells us where the Van Gogh and the other paintings are.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: Agent Hadley.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Do you know who this is?

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: Yeah.   I figured I'd be hearing from you.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: If you ever want to get those tapes, meet me in one hour at Grant Park near the statue.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: You think I'm going to talk to you until I know if you're wired.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Wired?    I ain't wired.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: Okay.   Okay.    I believe you.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: You killed her!

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: No. You killed her. Manager remembers you going into her room. Your fingerprints were found all over the place.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Bullshit! She was alive when we left her with you.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: You're fucked, Sami. You know it.   That's why you're here.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: Look, I just want out of this nightmare. I don't know these guys. A few days ago I'm in Paris picking pockets and now I'm America's most wanted.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: Where are the tapes?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: I can get them -- but what do I get if I do?

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: A pass.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: A pass? How you gonna give me a pass? A witness can put me at the crime scene.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: Witness' can be convinced they made a mistake. Without the murder weapon the D.A. won't have enough to prosecute you.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: They don't have a murder weapon?

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: No. I have it. The lamp? The one with your fingerprints and her blood on it?  Remember?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: You want the tapes for yourself.     You're going to sell them.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: I'm going to retire with a shit-load of money. Find me a small country that doesn't have an extradition treaty with the States and live the good life.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: You didn't have to kill Sophie.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: Yes I did.    Lose ends are messy.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: What about me? Aren't I a loose end?

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: When this is over you can say whatever the hell you want. I'll be long gone. Besides, who's going to believe you? You're just a two-bit crook.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: And you're a dirty cop. At least I don't pretend to be something different than what I am.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: What the fuck was all that about at the hotel last night? I thought we had a deal?

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: Hey, you're not exactly the most trustworthy guy in the world. I took a shot. It didn't work. Did you bring the tapes?

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: You want the tapes for yourself.     You're going to sell them.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: I'm going to retire with a shit-load of money. Find me a small country that doesn't have an extradition treaty with the States and live the good life.

turns.speaker: SAMI
turns.text: You didn't have to kill Sophie.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: Yes I did.    Lose ends are messy.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Zero.   That's all I know.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: You'll never get out of the city.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: This is turning to shit. If word gets out of my involvement in this I'll go to prison.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Listen, we know their names. They don't know the city. You'll find them. You're the FBI.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: I can't bring the Bureau into this.    If I do the tapes become evidence.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: They're supposed to be evidence.    That's why Bastaldi set this up.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: Fuck Bastaldi and his brother. These tapes are gold. Do you have any idea what Zammito would pay to get them back?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: I thought you wanted Zammito?

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: What for? The minute I get him some other Gavone will take his place. I've been doing this for twenty years. When I retire it's not going to be to some trailer park in the suburbs.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: Too many people know about my involvement in this.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Then we just have to make sure everyone who knows can't say anything.

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: Uh... excuse me, but don't you need a warrant or something?

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: Not today.   Where are your friends?

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: They left about a half hour ago.

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: Where did they go?

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: I dunno.

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: Hey man, you can't do that!

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: What?   This?

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: Jesus.   What kind of FBI agent are you?

turns.speaker: AGENT HADLEY
turns.text: I'm your worst fuckin' nightmare. Now, if you don't want me to keep on hurting you, it's important that I believe you and right now I don't. So tell me, where did they go?

turns.speaker: WAYNE
turns.text: I swear man, I don't know. They packed up and left a half hour ago.  All I got is one of their phone numbers in Paris.

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: It's Elvis...

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: It's me...

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: Marcel?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Yes. We went to the address we were given and had to tie up the owner of the house who turns out to be some Mafia guy.

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: You're there now?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Oui.

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: You're calling me on your cell phone, right?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: You're calling me on is phone?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Oui.

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: My number's going to show up on his bill!

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Should I call you back?

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: You've already robbed the safe?

turns.speaker: MARCEL
turns.text: Oui.

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: Take what you've got and get out of there.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Where's your brother?

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: Vincent's in the States on business.  That it?

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: Hey Daniel! Hello?  Do you guys speak English?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Uh, yeah.

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: Good.   I have a job for you in America.

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: Thank you Marcel, for that... extremely redundant explanation.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: C'mon, Laurant, America?

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: The job is worth about two million euros. Pull this off and you and your crew could make some real money, Daniel. You leave tomorrow.

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: I thought I would accompany you to the airport to say bon voyage... and tell you that Marcel will be going with you.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: This is a considerable move up for you, Daniel. The temptation of having so much money might be too much for you.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: You don't trust me?

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: I don't trust anyone. You don't get to the top of this game by trusting people... and after all, you are a thief. It's in your nature to steal. I'm just protecting my investment.

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: It's Daniel.

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: Daniel. Listen I'm afraid there has been a big--

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: -- I've got the tapes. If you ever want to see your brother out of jail do exactly what I say. Bring one million euros to your boat at six o'clock.

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: A million! I don't have that kind of money.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Don't bullshit me, Laurant!   I know about the Van Gogh.

turns.speaker: BASTALDI
turns.text: I don't have it. That's why Vincent went to Chicago. They arrested him before he could bring it back.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Well, you better get the money somehow. Six o'clock and come alone. If you don't we'll destroy the tapes.

turns.speaker: BOBBY BEANS
turns.text: Good. I'm doing good. How you doin', Frankie?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Good.   I'm good.

turns.speaker: BOBBY BEANS
turns.text: Mr. Maranzano sends his warmest regards.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: When you return please extend my regards to Mr. Maranzano and his family.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Can I offer you something.    A drink? Coffee?

turns.speaker: BOBBY BEANS
turns.text: No thank you.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: You sure? I just got a shipment of espresso from Sicily. Special blend. Can't find anything like it in the States.

turns.speaker: BOBBY BEANS
turns.text: I'm good.   Really.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Okay. I understand you're interested in one of our properties?

turns.speaker: BOBBY BEANS
turns.text: Yeah. That warehouse over on Merchant Street. The volume on our import business has risen dramatically. The proceeds this quarter will be supernumerary due to the --

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: -- Super what?

turns.speaker: BOBBY BEANS
turns.text: Supernumerary. It means better than expected.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Then why not just fuckin' say better than expected? Everybody knows what better than expected means.

turns.speaker: BOBBY BEANS
turns.text: I'm taking a vocabulary course to enhance my communication skills.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Okay.   How much?

turns.speaker: BOBBY BEANS
turns.text: I'm not here to negotiate.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Why are you here?

turns.speaker: BOBBY BEANS
turns.text: To tell you that we're interested in the property.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: You told me that on the phone. What the hell are you doing here? Showing off your communication skills? Go back to your people and tell them when they're serious to put a number on the table.

turns.speaker: BOBBY BEANS
turns.text: I will relay the particulars of our conversation to Mr. Maranzano.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Yeah -- you do that.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: Frankie, come in. Good to see you.      You want something?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: No, I'm good, Angelo.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: I understand Bobby Beans came to see you today.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Yeah. Seems Maranzano wants to talk about buying the Merchant Street warehouse.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: And nothing.     He's just feeling us out.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: He's trying to get a foot hold in our territory.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: He sticks his toes in the water again, we'll cut 'em off.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: Business must be good if he can afford to buy up useless property.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: I heard this quarter his profits are gonna be supernumerary.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: They're gonna be what?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Supernumerary. It means better than expected.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: Good word.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Someone else coming?

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: Nah, that's just Tony's way of telling me Judge Judy starts in ten minutes. You ever watch it?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Uh, no --

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: You should. You can learn a lot about the criminal justice system on a program like that. Very informative. Stay and watch it with me.

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: You know, I'm kind of tired. I'm just gonna go home if it's all the same to you.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: Oh Frankie, what's this I hear about your brother?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: He missed three weeks.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: Your own brother? You couldn't send someone else to do it?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: I did. Joey "Two Tons" and Nicky "The Rake" did the deed.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: But you were there?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Angelo, we live and die by the rules we make. We are men of honor, but honor without respect is a... horse-less carriage.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me about this?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: You have enough to worry about, Angelo. You don't need my problems.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: They knew who you were when they broke in your house?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: What is happening with the world? There was a time no civilian would touch a made man. Now every babbo in the world thinks he can get away with something. What did they take?

turns.speaker: ZAMMITO
turns.text: Some cash. Jewelry. The other stuff I can replace, but there's a cardboard box... photos of my mother. They're the only ones I have of her.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: We're doing everything we can to find these people. Right Tony?

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: Either you are incredibly brave, or incredibly stupid. Which one is it?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I guess we're going to find out.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: You rob an associate of mine... a friend and--

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Not such a good friend.   May I reach in my pocket?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I've got to tell you, Mr. Bonanno, This guy's an idiot. How he's lived this long is a mystery.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: I don't think it will be a mystery much longer.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: He's recorded every conversation he's had with you for years.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: I assume you want something?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: We've got a lot of people looking for us. We'd just like to go home.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: You want me to help you get out of the country?

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: And for my help I would get what?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Half the tapes.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: And the other half?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I'll destroy them when we get back to Paris.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: I only have your word for that.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I just want to get my people home. I know who you are and what you could do to me if I don't honor my word.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: Where are you staying?

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: I only ask so I can call you when the arrangements are made.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: How about if I call you?

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: This plane will take you to Canada. From there you can fly back to Paris.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: BONANNO
turns.text: You have something for me?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Tonight?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: I know they won't be home tonight.

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: If you think because you're a women this can't go hard on you, think again.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Laurant and Vincent were in business with Zammito.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: What kind of business?

turns.speaker: SOPHIE
turns.text: Black market art. Zammito got to a few key security guards at the Metropolitan Museum. The Bastaldi's supplied the artists to make copies of famous works. They'd switch the paintings, send the originals to Paris and the Bastaldi's would sell them to private collectors.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: You know what makes a good get away driver?  Being able to get away!

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: You're always pointing out my negative qualities. My analyst says positive reinforcement is a much more productive way of relating with people.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Not a good idea. Someone gets a license number and it all leads back to you. Raymond, you'll steal one.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Yeah.   We just go home.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: We can't.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I agree with Marcel. I say we go to the airport and get on a plane.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: No one has mentioned the part of the plan about us getting caught and going to prison.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: We're leaving. Raymond get the bag.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Forget the money! We've got bigger problems than the money right now.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: She probably hid it at her place.    The six of us could find it in --

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Why not just steal another one?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Too risky. We don't need to get pulled over because of a stolen car.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Get that, will you?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Why do I always have to answer the phone?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Because you're the closest.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I'm not any closer than you are.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Why is everything an argument with you?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I'm just setting my boundaries.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Raymond, grab the tapes.    We're leaving!

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Why do I have to pick up the tapes.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Jesus!

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: In English.   Sami doesn't speak French.

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: Where are you from?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Hopefully no one.

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: No one? Then why is Zero here?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I just want you there in case there's trouble.

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: And if there is, then Zero can kill someone?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: We'll see.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: He said to go fuck yourself.

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: We are tired and bored with your bullshit. So, put that stupid little knife away before Zero shoves it up your ass.

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: We are being watched. Daniel grabs the binoculars and looks.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Cops?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Bastaldi's dead. He is fuckin' dead!

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: You want Zero to kill him?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I'm going to kill him myself!

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: What about the money?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Bring me the scissors.

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: And the Vodka.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Cut his pants up the leg to the groin.

turns.speaker: ZERO
turns.text: And be careful when you get near the top. Zero has a very long one.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Turn on the flashlight.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: I'm trying.    It doesn't work.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: Do they come with batteries?

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: You didn't buy batteries?

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: I thought they came with batteries.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: I can't believe you didn't check.

turns.speaker: JULIEN
turns.text: I bought everything you put on the list. Gloves. Pen knives. Flashlight. Batteries were not on the list.

turns.speaker: DANIEL
turns.text: Why should I have to put it on the list? It's like saying to buy a car with tires.
